document_title: Basedow's disease: Causes, causes and diagnosis
subsection_content:
Basedow's disease is an autoimmune disease of the thyroid gland. Basedow's disease is the most common cause of hyperthyroidism, typical manifestations include: diffuse goiter, proptosis, and pretibial myxedema. The disease is associated with the presence of thyroid-stimulating antibodies.
Women get the disease 5-10 times more often than men. The disease can occur at any age but most often occurs between the ages of 20 and 40. (1)
subsection_title: benh basedow.json. What is Basedow's disease?
subsection_data:
